    • registerGameSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register") public String registerGameSubmit(@ModelAttribute GameForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      The function checks if the home team and visitor team aren't the same, if the stadium isn't occupied at the time of the game, and if the teams exist. If all of these conditions are met, the game is created
      Parameters:
      form - The form that is used to create a new game.
      model - The model is a Map of objects that will be passed to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A string

      Returns:
      A list of games

    • gameProfile

      @GetMapping("/profile") public String gameProfile(@RequestParam(name="id",required=true) int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It gets the game with the given id, and if it exists, it gets the events for that game, and then returns the game profile page with the game and events
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the game to be displayed
      model - This is the model that will be passed to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A game profile page

      Parameters:

    • updateBeginDate

      @PostMapping("/edit/date") public String updateBeginDate(@RequestParam(name="id") int id, @ModelAttribute GameForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes the id of a game, a GameForm object, a Model object, and a RedirectAttributes object. It then uses the GameForm object to get the new date and time of the game, and then uses the GameService to update the game's date and time
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the game to be updated
      form - The form that is used to update the game.
      model - The model is a map of values that will be passed to the view.
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a Spring class that allows you to add attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the game profile page.

    • deleteGame

      @GetMapping("/delete") public String deleteGame(@RequestParam(name="id",required=true) int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function is called when the user clicks the delete button on the game page. It takes the id of the game as a parameter and returns the delete page
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the game to be deleted.
      model - The model is an object that holds data that you want to pass to the view.
      Returns:
      A string

    • deleteGameConfirm

      @PostMapping("/delete") public String deleteGameConfirm(@RequestParam(name="id",required=true) int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function is called when the user clicks the delete button on the game list page. It takes the id of the game to be deleted as a parameter and deletes the game from the database
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the game to be deleted
      model - This is the model that will be passed to the view.
      Returns:
      A string that is the name of the view to be rendered.
